result.execSummary:
The defendant Lorenzo Obrian Austin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court authorizes transfer of the probation term to Mississippi.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$280 court costs to be paid from count 2.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Under the Huber Law. 

Time served.

records.addlTxt:
2:40 pm - Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lorenzo Obrian Austin in court. Not eligible for public defender.  PFAC forms given to defendant.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

$100.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond. 
--Matthew Henry, 35363 Glen Lane, Wildomar, CA  92595
Order to report to MCSD for photos and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess marijuana and felon possessing firearm.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 07-11-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $100.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and defendant is not to possess any weapons.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.
